title: CSV Topic Guesser
description: A web app that allows users to upload a CSV file, parses its content, and uses the internal LLM to guess the dataset's subject or purpose.

pages.name: Home
pages.purpose: Upload CSV, trigger analysis, and display the guessed topic.

ui_components: Result card showing the guessed topic
state: csvData: array of objects representing parsed rows
guessResult: string containing the LLM's guess
isLoading: boolean indicating AI call in progress
errorMessage: string for any parsing or AI errors
interactions: User selects a CSV file → Papa Parse reads the file into csvData.
User clicks 'Analyze' button → set isLoading true, build a prompt with a preview of csvData (first 10 rows) and call window.geaRuntimeLLM(prompt).
Receive LLM response → store in guessResult, set isLoading false, display result card.
If parsing fails or LLM returns an error → set errorMessage and show SweetAlert2 toast.
Cache last successful csvData and guessResult using window.geaRuntimeStore.set('lastCsv', {data, result}) so the app can restore state on reload.
acceptance_criteria: CSV file can be uploaded via file input; only .csv files accepted.
File is parsed client‑side with Papa Parse; parsing errors are shown to the user.
After clicking Analyze, a loading indicator appears while the LLM processes the request.
The app calls window.geaRuntimeLLM with a prompt that includes a concise preview of the CSV (e.g., first 10 rows) and asks the model to guess the dataset's topic.
The guessed topic is displayed in a readable card format.
Errors from the LLM or parsing are shown using SweetAlert2.
The UI is responsive and uses Tailwind/DaisyUI styling.
Last successful analysis is persisted via window.geaRuntimeStore and restored on page reload.
